org.rdkit.knime.nodes

Interface TableViewSupport

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    RDKitInteractiveTableNodeModel, RDKitSmilesHeadersNodeModel, SubstructureCounterNodeModel

    public interface TableViewSupport
    This interface must be implemented by node models when we want to be able to connect an interactive view with it. It provides functionality to restore saved table data when a workflow loads (BufferedDataTableHolder) and also the functionality to generate a content model a view can work on.
    Author:
    Manuel Schwarze

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      TableContentModel getContentModel(boolean bIsInputTable, int iIndex)
      Returns the content model of table data to be used in a view.
      int[] getInputTablesToConserve()
      Returns the list of indices of input tables, which shall be used in table views.
      int[] getOutputTablesToConserve()
      Returns the list of indices of output tables, which shall be used in table views.

    • Method Detail

      • getInputTablesToConserve

        int[] getInputTablesToConserve()
        Returns the list of indices of input tables, which shall be used in table views.
        Returns:
        List of indices of input tables or empty array, if nothing shall be conserved.

      • getOutputTablesToConserve

        int[] getOutputTablesToConserve()
        Returns the list of indices of output tables, which shall be used in table views.
        Returns:
        List of indices of output tables or empty array, if nothing shall be conserved.

      • getContentModel

        TableContentModel getContentModel(boolean bIsInputTable,
                                  int iIndex)
        Returns the content model of table data to be used in a view.
        Parameters:
        bIsInputTable - Set to true, if the passed in index is from an input table. Set to false, if the passed in index is from an output table.
        iIndex - Index of a port (table).
        Returns:
        Table content model or null, if unavailable.
        See Also:
        getInputTablesToConserve(), getOutputTablesToConserve()
